Product is great, had for about 3 months now. Connects very quickly, easy to adjust, tilt function is awesome for hill training. Really love it.

reviews.content: This is an excellent bundle. Assembling the bike, desk was extremely simple, and fitting the bike to me using the Wahoo app by taking a picture of my old bike was a breeze. I also love the fan and how it changes speeds with my speed. With the wind in my face and the bike adjusting it's angle based on the gradient, this is as close to real cycling that one can experience in a garage. My only complaint was it took quite a bit of tries to get the new firmware on the bike to activate the wifi, but once I was able to do that, it updates itself and all is well.
reviews.title: This is an excellent bundle.

reviews.content: The adjustability was key for me in this purchase allowing everyone in my family to be able to use it. I’ve use the kikr for years but nobody could use it because my bike was on it. Best next thing is the simulated cassette combos to mix up gear for different style rides- want two or three rings up front? Want different shifting? It is there.
reviews.title: Excellent engineering

reviews.content:
I've wanted a KICKR Bike since it first came out, but delayed buying one because I had an original Kickr that worked well. When it died, I didn't think I should spend a lot replacing it, so I got another smart trainer. It was fine.

When V2 came out, I was curious about deals on V1 Bikes, and am so glad I looked into it. I've had the KICKR Bike setup for just over a week now, and it's really so much better than I imagined. I love this thing.

So smooth, responsive and quiet. Even my 'silent' trainer is multiples louder. I've read some comments about thigh rub due to the width of the unit, but I have had no issue (and I don't have skinny legs).

Works beautifully with Zwift (which I'm also new to). I had a Tacx trainer and used their app, which won't work with the KICKR Bike, which is such a shame. Riding real, outdoor rides is so nice (plus I have a wasted subscription now). I'll have to check out Wahoo SYSTM to get back to that. I used to train with Sufferfest, so it should be easy to get back into. Zwift is neat, but I do like seeing real, actual worlds if I'm stuck indoors.

But the KICKR Bike...only issue is that I waited so long to get it. It's really fantastic.
reviews.title: Incredible training experience. Wish I bought it sooner.

reviews.content:
From the unboxing, to the easy setup, to very easy fitting, and getting into an actual ride and enjoying; this is one of the nicest pieces of exercise equipment I've ever used. 

to address the concerns of some that there's some 'play' or looseness in the handlebars; its the incline/decline feature... it has to have a little bit of play in it; but it is a fun simulation feature as well. 

riding on this is really fun; its smooth; like riding a perfectly tuned track bike; with perfect pressure; except you can change gears and you have a flywheel. excellent experience there. 

I was previously using a kickr v5 with a bike attached to it; and this was a definite upgrade from that experience. again; this is a sturdy unit. a lot of fun to ride; and highly accurate. definite recommendation.
reviews.title: Smooth; great experience

reviews.content:
From a newcomer to road cycling (ironman 70.3 first timer), this indoor trainer is the first time I've been on something other than the typical gym cardio bike.
This trainer doesn't even really compare. It is on a whole other level of trainer.
Everything has been super simple to set up and use, and I'm now learning about the Systm triathlon plans as a potential alternative to my existing training structure.

In short, love the bike! Assuming it doesn't fail in the next 12 months, this is a 5/5 purchase (saddle is a 1/5, but I speculate anyone buying this already has a strong opinion on saddles and will replace the stock one).
reviews.title: Happy Customer

reviews.content: My 1st Wahoo purchase was the KICKR SNAP about 2 years ago and I absolutely loved it. My reason for purchasing that model was the price point as an entry to in home bike trainers until I could gauge my commitment. 2 years later, I decided to upgrade to the KICKR Bike and I couldn't be happier. In fact, I am more consistent with riding due to the fact that I no longer have to attach/detach my outdoor bike, it's leagues quieter, no calibration necessary, no checking air pressure, I can turn, automatic incline/decline, and smaller foot print. I would absolutely recommend for anyone who already knows they enjoy cycling. You will not regret it!!!
reviews.title: Upgraded from KICKR SNAP

reviews.content:
It might be the best thing since sliced bread! It changes the way I train, it makes it way more effective, training is easier to do; I just love it!
I had an old spinner bike that I kind of modified with sensors and a power meter pedal, but there is no erg mode and I had to basically "shift" with the tensioning knob.
I knew that someday I would get a true smart trainer, and I was not really keen on one where I had to take my bike on and off. Therefore this kicker bike fits the bill nicely! The ability to virtually change bicycles with the application it's just awesome!
I've done about 200 virtual miles on it and it seems to work just flawlessly! You've done great work in my opinion!
reviews.title: Wahoo Kickr Bike V1 Review 1-8-23

reviews.content:
The V1 bike is an impressive machine. My initial riding impressions that the bike was very solid and the experience was not dissimilar to my road bike with a KICKR. Interestingly, the more I ride it the less I think
about the idea of a trainer bike since it has the feel and response of my road machines. As such, I can focus of whatever training program I am doing and know that the ride experience and performance it delivers is there without obsessing over what is producing that experience.
I use Di2 on all my bikes and the KICR Bike is very realistic to an outdoor ride. The grade change feature has required little adaptation and is a great feature.
Well done Wahoo!!
reviews.title: KICKR Bike Review

features.name: features
features.sentence: The grade change feature has required little adaptation and is a great feature.

machine.sentence: The V1 bike is an impressive machine.

experience.sentence: My initial riding impressions that the bike was very solid and the experience was not dissimilar to my road bike with a KICKR.

bike.sentence: The V1 bike is an impressive machine.

reviews.content: I had been contemplating getting the Kickr Bike for a while, and a Black Friday deal made it too good to pass up. I setup the bike using the numbers from a Retul bike fit on my road bike, and with a few tweaks, it was perfect. I swapped out the bars for a more ergonomic style and with thicker bar tape which improved the comfort. I love that you can program the gears and shifting with the Wahoo app. Now that shifting is much easier, I increased the Zwift trainer difficulty above 50% to capture more of the incline/decline on the Kickr Bike. OVer all this is a significant step up from the Wahoo Kickr v2 I was using before. I also appreciate the increased accuracy and the fact that the Bike is auto calibrated.
reviews.title: All I'll ever need for indoor training

tape.name: tape
tape.sentence: I swapped out the bars for a more ergonomic style and with thicker bar tape which improved the comfort.

Overall, super pleased with my purchase.
